title: Rule
text: If bx is $$0$$ and c is negative, then the simplified form will be $$\left(nx+m\right) \left(nx-m\right)$$. $$n$$ is the square root of a and $$m$$ is the square root of -c

title: Factors
text: In this equation $${ax}^2+bx+c$$ the square root of a and -c are $$1$$ and $$4$$ respectfully

title: Plug in
text: Plug into the perfect square simplified form $$\left(nx+m\right) \left(nx-m\right)$$
